findings.white_cell_count: 22,500 per cubic mm, with 87% neutrophils and 5% lymphocytes

findings.initial_culture: Gram-negative rods in a single anaerobic bottle

laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: The organism from blood culture was identified as Pseudomonas luteola on day 6.

laboratory_examinations.date: Not specified (but on or after transfer to another hospital)
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Creatinine levels decreased from 1.4 mg/dL to 0.7 mg/dL; bilirubin levels decreased from 1.4 mg/dL to 0.7 mg/dL.

findings.description: Bilateral ground-glass opacities, bilateral small effusions, right hilar and subcarinal lymphadenopathy.

laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Repeat CT revealed worsening ground-glass opacities into areas of dense consolidation and worsening bilateral effusions by day 14.
